title: RNS Camelia
content:
I'm searching for a font with similar characteristics to RNS Camelia (Open Type), but with a full family. I am really liking the look of it, but it isn't really functional for the project I'm putting together without any other weights. Any suggestions?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 2.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20110810001055/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%202_193.png) | 32.63 KB |
author: annelisedekker

comments.content: It's obviously based on Avant Garde. There is a version of it with larger serifs: Lubalin Graph.
Yeah, but nicer than Avant Garde & Lubalin Graph somehow. Thanks! The search continues.

Good luck. "Nice" is not a good description of the quality you're looking for. Whatever you're doing, keep in mind that Camelia is not really a text font. The playfully small serifs ask for larger point sizes.

Andreas
Sorry, do I annoy you? Can I post a new topic "What are your favourite fonts?" here?
